right_dist_ne_zero_of_angle_eq_pi:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If ∠ABC = π then dist C B ≠ 0. -/
theorem right_dist_ne_zero_of_angle_eq_pi {p1 p2 p3 : P} (h : (angle) p1 p2 p3 = real.pi) : dist p3 p2 ≠ 0 :=
  left_dist_ne_zero_of_angle_eq_pi <| (angle_comm _ _ _).trans h
#align right_dist_ne_zero_of_angle_eq_pi right_dist_ne_zero_of_angle_eq_pi
left_dist_ne_zero_of_angle_eq_pi:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If ∠ABC = π then dist A B ≠ 0. -/
theorem left_dist_ne_zero_of_angle_eq_pi {p1 p2 p3 : P} (h : (angle) p1 p2 p3 = real.pi) : dist p1 p2 ≠ 0 :=
  by
  by_contra heq
  rw [dist_eq_zero] at heq
  rw [HEq, angle_eq_left] at h
  exact real.pi_ne_zero (by linarith)
#align left_dist_ne_zero_of_angle_eq_pi left_dist_ne_zero_of_angle_eq_pi
dist_eq_add_dist_of_angle_eq_pi:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If ∠ABC = π, then (dist A C) = (dist A B) + (dist B C). -/
theorem dist_eq_add_dist_of_angle_eq_pi {p1 p2 p3 : P} (h : (angle) p1 p2 p3 = real.pi) :
    dist p1 p3 = dist p1 p2 + dist p3 p2 :=
  by
  rw [dist_eq_norm_vsub V, dist_eq_norm_vsub V, dist_eq_norm_vsub V, ← vsub_sub_vsub_cancel_right]
  exact norm_sub_eq_add_norm_of_angle_eq_pi h
#align dist_eq_add_dist_of_angle_eq_pi dist_eq_add_dist_of_angle_eq_pi
dist_eq_add_dist_iff_angle_eq_pi:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If A ≠ B and C ≠ B then ∠ABC = π if and only if (dist A C) = (dist A B) + (dist B C). -/
theorem dist_eq_add_dist_iff_angle_eq_pi {p1 p2 p3 : P} (hp1p2 : p1 ≠ p2) (hp3p2 : p3 ≠ p2) :
    dist p1 p3 = dist p1 p2 + dist p3 p2 ↔ (angle) p1 p2 p3 = real.pi :=
  by
  rw [dist_eq_norm_vsub V, dist_eq_norm_vsub V, dist_eq_norm_vsub V, ← vsub_sub_vsub_cancel_right]
  exact
    norm_sub_eq_add_norm_iff_angle_eq_pi (fun he => hp1p2 (vsub_eq_zero_iff_eq.1 he)) fun he =>
      hp3p2 (vsub_eq_zero_iff_eq.1 he)
#align dist_eq_add_dist_iff_angle_eq_pi dist_eq_add_dist_iff_angle_eq_pi

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- If ∠ABC = 0, then (dist A C) = abs ((dist A B) - (dist B C)). -/
theorem dist_eq_abs_sub_dist_of_angle_eq_zero {p1 p2 p3 : P} (h : (angle) p1 p2 p3 = 0) :
    dist p1 p3 = |dist p1 p2 - dist p3 p2| :=
  by
  rw [dist_eq_norm_vsub V, dist_eq_norm_vsub V, dist_eq_norm_vsub V, ← vsub_sub_vsub_cancel_right]
  exact norm_sub_eq_abs_sub_norm_of_angle_eq_zero h

dist_eq_abs_sub_dist_iff_angle_eq_zero:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- If A ≠ B and C ≠ B then ∠ABC = 0 if and only if (dist A C) = abs ((dist A B) - (dist B C)). -/
theorem dist_eq_abs_sub_dist_iff_angle_eq_zero {p1 p2 p3 : P} (hp1p2 : p1 ≠ p2) (hp3p2 : p3 ≠ p2) :
    dist p1 p3 = |dist p1 p2 - dist p3 p2| ↔ (angle) p1 p2 p3 = 0 :=
  by
  rw [dist_eq_norm_vsub V, dist_eq_norm_vsub V, dist_eq_norm_vsub V, ← vsub_sub_vsub_cancel_right]
  exact
    norm_sub_eq_abs_sub_norm_iff_angle_eq_zero (fun he => hp1p2 (vsub_eq_zero_iff_eq.1 he)) fun he =>
      hp3p2 (vsub_eq_zero_iff_eq.1 he)

continuous_at_angle:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-
Copyright (c) 2020 Joseph Myers. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Joseph Myers, Manuel Candales
-/
theorem continuous_at_angle {x : P × P × P} (hx12 : x.1 ≠ x.2.1) (hx32 : x.2.2 ≠ x.2.1) :
    continuous_at (fun y : P × P × P => (angle) y.1 y.2.1 y.2.2) x :=
  by
  let f : P × P × P → V × V := fun y => («expr -ᵥ » y.1 y.2.1, «expr -ᵥ » y.2.2 y.2.1)
  have hf1 : (f x).1 ≠ 0 := by simp [hx12]
  have hf2 : (f x).2 ≠ 0 := by simp [hx32]
  exact
    (inner_product_geometry.continuous_at_angle hf1 hf2).comp
      ((continuous_fst.vsub continuous_snd.fst).prod_mk (continuous_snd.snd.vsub continuous_snd.fst)).continuous_at
#align continuous_at_angle continuous_at_angle
collinear_of_angle_eq_zero:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/-- If the angle between three points is 0, they are collinear. -/
theorem collinear_of_angle_eq_zero {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ = 0) :
    collinear (exprℝ) ({p₁, p₂, p₃} : set P) :=
  collinear_iff_eq_or_eq_or_angle_eq_zero_or_angle_eq_pi.2 <| or.inr <| or.inr <| or.inl h
#align collinear_of_angle_eq_zero collinear_of_angle_eq_zero
collinear_of_angle_eq_pi:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/-- If the angle between three points is π, they are collinear. -/
theorem collinear_of_angle_eq_pi {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ = real.pi) :
    collinear (exprℝ) ({p₁, p₂, p₃} : set P) :=
  collinear_iff_eq_or_eq_or_angle_eq_zero_or_angle_eq_pi.2 <| or.inr <| or.inr <| or.inr h
#align collinear_of_angle_eq_pi collinear_of_angle_eq_pi
collinear_iff_eq_or_eq_or_angle_eq_zero_:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- Three points are collinear if and only if the first or third point equals the second or the
angle between them is 0 or π. -/
theorem collinear_iff_eq_or_eq_or_angle_eq_zero_or_angle_eq_pi {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} :
    collinear (exprℝ) ({p₁, p₂, p₃} : set P) ↔ p₁ = p₂ ∨ p₃ = p₂ ∨ (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ = 0 ∨ (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ = real.pi :=
  by
  refine' ⟨fun h => _, fun h => _⟩
  · replace h := h.wbtw_or_wbtw_or_wbtw
    by_cases h₁₂ : p₁ = p₂
    · exact or.inl h₁₂
    by_cases h₃₂ : p₃ = p₂
    · exact or.inr (or.inl h₃₂)
    rw [or_iff_right h₁₂, or_iff_right h₃₂]
    rcases h with (h | h | h)
    · exact or.inr (angle_eq_pi_iff_sbtw.2 ⟨h, ne.symm h₁₂, ne.symm h₃₂⟩)
    · exact or.inl (h.angle₃₁₂_eq_zero_of_ne h₃₂)
    · exact or.inl (h.angle₂₃₁_eq_zero_of_ne h₁₂)
  · rcases h with (rfl | rfl | h | h)
    · simpa using collinear_pair (exprℝ) p₁ p₃
    · simpa using collinear_pair (exprℝ) p₁ p₃
    · rw [angle_eq_zero_iff_ne_and_wbtw] at h
      rcases h with (⟨-, h⟩ | ⟨-, h⟩)
      · rw [Set.insert_comm]
        exact h.collinear
      · rw [Set.insert_comm, Set.pair_comm]
        exact h.collinear
    · rw [angle_eq_pi_iff_sbtw] at h
      exact h.wbtw.collinear
#align collinear_iff_eq_or_eq_or_angle_eq_zero_or_angle_eq_pi collinear_iff_eq_or_eq_or_angle_eq_zero_or_angle_eq_pi

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If the second of three points is strictly between the other two, the angle at that point
(reversed) is π. -/
theorem _root_.sbtw.angle₃₂₁_eq_pi {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : sbtw (exprℝ) p₁ p₂ p₃) : (angle) p₃ p₂ p₁ = real.pi := by
  rw [← h.angle₁₂₃_eq_pi, angle_comm]
#align sbtw.angle₃₂₁_eq_pi sbtw.angle₃₂₁_eq_pi

/-- If the second of three points is weakly between the other two, and not equal to the first,
the angle at the first point (reversed) is zero. -/
theorem _root_.wbtw.angle₃₁₂_eq_zero_of_ne {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : wbtw (exprℝ) p₁ p₂ p₃) (hp₂p₁ : p₂ ≠ p₁) :
    (angle) p₃ p₁ p₂ = 0 := by rw [← h.angle₂₁₃_eq_zero_of_ne hp₂p₁, angle_comm]

  h.wbtw.angle₃₁₂_eq_zero_of_ne h.ne_left

the angle at the third point is zero. -/
theorem _root_.wbtw.angle₂₃₁_eq_zero_of_ne {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : wbtw (exprℝ) p₁ p₂ p₃) (hp₂p₃ : p₂ ≠ p₃) :

/-- If the second of three points is strictly between the other two, the angle at the third point

theorem _root_.sbtw.angle₂₃₁_eq_zero {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : sbtw (exprℝ) p₁ p₂ p₃) : (angle) p₂ p₃ p₁ = 0 :=

angle₂₁₃_eq_zero_of_ne:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- If the second of three points is weakly between the other two, and not equal to the first,
the angle at the first point is zero. -/
theorem _root_.wbtw.angle₂₁₃_eq_zero_of_ne {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : wbtw (exprℝ) p₁ p₂ p₃) (hp₂p₁ : p₂ ≠ p₁) :
    (angle) p₂ p₁ p₃ = 0 := by
  rw [angle, angle_eq_zero_iff]
  rcases h with ⟨r, ⟨hr0, hr1⟩, rfl⟩
  have hr0' : r ≠ 0 := by
    rintro rfl
    simpa using hp₂p₁
  replace hr0 := hr0.lt_of_ne hr0'.symm
  refine' ⟨vsub_ne_zero.2 hp₂p₁, r⁻¹, inv_pos.2 hr0, _⟩
  rw [affine_map.line_map_apply, vadd_vsub_assoc, vsub_self, add_zero, smul_smul, inv_mul_cancel hr0', one_smul]
#align wbtw.angle₂₁₃_eq_zero_of_ne wbtw.angle₂₁₃_eq_zero_of_ne

angle₁₂₃_eq_pi:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If the second of three points is strictly between the other two, the angle at that point
is π. -/
theorem _root_.sbtw.angle₁₂₃_eq_pi {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : sbtw (exprℝ) p₁ p₂ p₃) : (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ = real.pi :=
  by
  rw [angle, angle_eq_pi_iff]
  rcases h with ⟨⟨r, ⟨hr0, hr1⟩, hp₂⟩, hp₂p₁, hp₂p₃⟩
  refine' ⟨vsub_ne_zero.2 hp₂p₁.symm, -(1 - r) / r, _⟩
  have hr0' : r ≠ 0 := by
    rintro rfl
    rw [← hp₂] at hp₂p₁
    simpa using hp₂p₁
  have hr1' : r ≠ 1 := by
    rintro rfl
    rw [← hp₂] at hp₂p₃
    simpa using hp₂p₃
  replace hr0 := hr0.lt_of_ne hr0'.symm
  replace hr1 := hr1.lt_of_ne hr1'
  refine' ⟨div_neg_of_neg_of_pos (left.neg_neg_iff.2 (sub_pos.2 hr1)) hr0, _⟩
  rw [← hp₂, affine_map.line_map_apply, vsub_vadd_eq_vsub_sub, vsub_vadd_eq_vsub_sub, vsub_self, zero_sub, smul_neg,
    smul_smul, div_mul_cancel _ hr0', neg_smul, neg_neg, sub_eq_iff_eq_add, ← add_smul, sub_add_cancel, one_smul]
#align sbtw.angle₁₂₃_eq_pi sbtw.angle₁₂₃_eq_pi
angle_vsub_const:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- Angles are translation invariant -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_vsub_const (p₁ p₂ p₃ p : P) :
    (angle) («expr -ᵥ » p₁ p) («expr -ᵥ » p₂ p) («expr -ᵥ » p₃ p) = (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ :=
  (affine_isometry_equiv.vadd_const (exprℝ) p).symm.to_affine_isometry.angle_map _ _ _
#align angle_vsub_const angle_vsub_const
angle_vadd_const:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr +ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr +ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr +ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- Angles are translation invariant -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_vadd_const (v₁ v₂ v₃ : V) (p : P) :
    (angle) («expr +ᵥ » v₁ p) («expr +ᵥ » v₂ p) («expr +ᵥ » v₃ p) = (angle) v₁ v₂ v₃ :=
  (affine_isometry_equiv.vadd_const (exprℝ) p).to_affine_isometry.angle_map _ _ _
#align angle_vadd_const angle_vadd_const
angle_sub_const:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- Angles in a vector space are translation invariant -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_sub_const (v₁ v₂ v₃ : V) (v : V) : (angle) (v₁ - v) (v₂ - v) (v₃ - v) = (angle) v₁ v₂ v₃ := by
  simpa only [vsub_eq_sub] using angle_vsub_const v₁ v₂ v₃ v
#align angle_sub_const angle_sub_const
angle_right_midpoint_eq_pi_div_two_of_di:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If M is the midpoint of the segment AB and C is the same distance from A as it is from B
then ∠CMB = π / 2. -/
theorem angle_right_midpoint_eq_pi_div_two_of_dist_eq {p1 p2 p3 : P} (h : dist p3 p1 = dist p3 p2) :
    (angle) p3 (midpoint (exprℝ) p1 p2) p2 = real.pi / 2 := by
  rw [midpoint_comm p1 p2, angle_left_midpoint_eq_pi_div_two_of_dist_eq h.symm]
#align angle_right_midpoint_eq_pi_div_two_of_dist_eq angle_right_midpoint_eq_pi_div_two_of_dist_eq
angle_pos_of_not_collinear:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- If three points are not collinear, the angle between them is positive. -/
theorem angle_pos_of_not_collinear {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : ¬collinear (exprℝ) ({p₁, p₂, p₃} : set P)) :
    0 < (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ :=
  (angle_nonneg _ _ _).lt_of_ne (angle_ne_zero_of_not_collinear h).symm
#align angle_pos_of_not_collinear angle_pos_of_not_collinear
angle_nonneg:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- The angle at a point is nonnegative. -/
theorem angle_nonneg (p1 p2 p3 : P) : 0 ≤ (angle) p1 p2 p3 :=
  angle_nonneg _ _
#align angle_nonneg angle_nonneg
angle_neg:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- Angles in a vector space are invariant to inversion -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_neg (v₁ v₂ v₃ : V) : (angle) (-v₁) (-v₂) (-v₃) = (angle) v₁ v₂ v₃ := by
  simpa only [zero_sub] using angle_const_sub 0 v₁ v₂ v₃
#align angle_neg angle_neg
angle_ne_zero_of_not_collinear:

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- If three points are not collinear, the angle between them is nonzero. -/
theorem angle_ne_zero_of_not_collinear {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : ¬collinear (exprℝ) ({p₁, p₂, p₃} : set P)) :
    (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ ≠ 0 :=
  mt collinear_of_angle_eq_zero h
#align angle_ne_zero_of_not_collinear angle_ne_zero_of_not_collinear
angle_ne_pi_of_not_collinear:

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If three points are not collinear, the angle between them is not π. -/
theorem angle_ne_pi_of_not_collinear {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : ¬collinear (exprℝ) ({p₁, p₂, p₃} : set P)) :
    (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ ≠ real.pi :=
  mt collinear_of_angle_eq_pi h

angle_midpoint_eq_pi:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If M is the midpoint of the segment AB, then ∠AMB = π. -/
theorem angle_midpoint_eq_pi (p1 p2 : P) (hp1p2 : p1 ≠ p2) : (angle) p1 (midpoint (exprℝ) p1 p2) p2 = real.pi :=
  by
  have : «expr -ᵥ » p2 (midpoint (exprℝ) p1 p2) = -«expr -ᵥ » p1 (midpoint (exprℝ) p1 p2) :=
    by
    rw [neg_vsub_eq_vsub_rev]
    simp
  simp [angle, this, hp1p2, -zero_lt_one]
#align angle_midpoint_eq_pi angle_midpoint_eq_pi
angle_map:

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
@[simp]
theorem _root_.affine_isometry.angle_map {V₂ P₂ : Type _} [inner_product_space (exprℝ) V₂] [metric_space P₂]
    [normed_add_torsor V₂ P₂] (f : «expr →ᵃⁱ[ ] » P (exprℝ) P₂) (p₁ p₂ p₃ : P) :
    (angle) (f p₁) (f p₂) (f p₃) = (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ := by
  simp_rw [angle, ← affine_isometry.map_vsub, linear_isometry.angle_map]
#align affine_isometry.angle_map affine_isometry.angle_map
angle_lt_pi_of_not_collinear:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If three points are not collinear, the angle between them is less than π. -/
theorem angle_lt_pi_of_not_collinear {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} (h : ¬collinear (exprℝ) ({p₁, p₂, p₃} : set P)) :
    (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ < real.pi :=
  (angle_le_pi _ _ _).lt_of_ne <| angle_ne_pi_of_not_collinear h
#align angle_lt_pi_of_not_collinear angle_lt_pi_of_not_collinear
angle_left_midpoint_eq_pi_div_two_of_dis:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If M is the midpoint of the segment AB and C is the same distance from A as it is from B
then ∠CMA = π / 2. -/
theorem angle_left_midpoint_eq_pi_div_two_of_dist_eq {p1 p2 p3 : P} (h : dist p3 p1 = dist p3 p2) :
    (angle) p3 (midpoint (exprℝ) p1 p2) p1 = real.pi / 2 :=
  by
  let m : P := midpoint (exprℝ) p1 p2
  have h1 : «expr -ᵥ » p3 p1 = «expr -ᵥ » p3 m - «expr -ᵥ » p1 m := (vsub_sub_vsub_cancel_right p3 p1 m).symm
  have h2 : «expr -ᵥ » p3 p2 = «expr -ᵥ » p3 m + «expr -ᵥ » p1 m := by
    rw [left_vsub_midpoint, ← midpoint_vsub_right, vsub_add_vsub_cancel]
  rw [dist_eq_norm_vsub V p3 p1, dist_eq_norm_vsub V p3 p2, h1, h2] at h
  exact (norm_add_eq_norm_sub_iff_angle_eq_pi_div_two («expr -ᵥ » p3 m) («expr -ᵥ » p1 m)).mp h.symm
#align angle_left_midpoint_eq_pi_div_two_of_dist_eq angle_left_midpoint_eq_pi_div_two_of_dist_eq

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- The angle at a point is at most π. -/
theorem angle_le_pi (p1 p2 p3 : P) : (angle) p1 p2 p3 ≤ real.pi :=
  angle_le_pi _ _
#align angle_le_pi angle_le_pi
angle_eq_zero_of_angle_eq_pi_right:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- If the angle ∠ABC at a point is π, the angle ∠BCA is 0. -/
theorem angle_eq_zero_of_angle_eq_pi_right {p1 p2 p3 : P} (h : (angle) p1 p2 p3 = real.pi) : (angle) p2 p3 p1 = 0 :=
  by
  rw [angle_comm] at h
  exact angle_eq_zero_of_angle_eq_pi_left h
#align angle_eq_zero_of_angle_eq_pi_right angle_eq_zero_of_angle_eq_pi_right
angle_eq_zero_of_angle_eq_pi_left:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- If the angle ∠ABC at a point is π, the angle ∠BAC is 0. -/
theorem angle_eq_zero_of_angle_eq_pi_left {p1 p2 p3 : P} (h : (angle) p1 p2 p3 = real.pi) : (angle) p2 p1 p3 = 0 :=
  by
  unfold angle at h
  rw [angle_eq_pi_iff] at h
  rcases h with ⟨hp1p2, ⟨r, ⟨hr, hpr⟩⟩⟩
  unfold angle
  rw [angle_eq_zero_iff]
  rw [← neg_vsub_eq_vsub_rev, neg_ne_zero] at hp1p2
  use hp1p2, -r + 1, add_pos (neg_pos_of_neg hr) zero_lt_one
  rw [add_smul, ← neg_vsub_eq_vsub_rev p1 p2, smul_neg]
  simp [← hpr]
#align angle_eq_zero_of_angle_eq_pi_left angle_eq_zero_of_angle_eq_pi_left
angle_eq_zero_iff_ne_and_wbtw:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/-- The angle between three points is zero if and only if one of the first and third points is
weakly between the other two, and not equal to the second. -/
theorem angle_eq_zero_iff_ne_and_wbtw {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} :
    (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ = 0 ↔ p₁ ≠ p₂ ∧ wbtw (exprℝ) p₂ p₁ p₃ ∨ p₃ ≠ p₂ ∧ wbtw (exprℝ) p₂ p₃ p₁ :=
  by
  constructor
  · rw [angle, angle_eq_zero_iff]
    rintro ⟨hp₁p₂, r, hr0, hp₃p₂⟩
    rcases le_or_lt 1 r with (hr1 | hr1)
    · refine' or.inl ⟨vsub_ne_zero.1 hp₁p₂, r⁻¹, ⟨(inv_pos.2 hr0).le, inv_le_one hr1⟩, _⟩
      rw [affine_map.line_map_apply, hp₃p₂, smul_smul, inv_mul_cancel hr0.ne.symm, one_smul, vsub_vadd]
    · refine' or.inr ⟨_, r, ⟨hr0.le, hr1.le⟩, _⟩
      · rw [← @vsub_ne_zero V, hp₃p₂, smul_ne_zero_iff]
        exact ⟨hr0.ne.symm, hp₁p₂⟩
      · rw [affine_map.line_map_apply, ← hp₃p₂, vsub_vadd]
  · rintro (⟨hp₁p₂, h⟩ | ⟨hp₃p₂, h⟩)
    · exact h.angle₂₁₃_eq_zero_of_ne hp₁p₂
    · exact h.angle₃₁₂_eq_zero_of_ne hp₃p₂
#align angle_eq_zero_iff_ne_and_wbtw angle_eq_zero_iff_ne_and_wbtw
angle_eq_zero_iff_eq_and_ne_or_sbtw:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/-- The angle between three points is zero if and only if one of the first and third points is
strictly between the other two, or those two points are equal but not equal to the second. -/
theorem angle_eq_zero_iff_eq_and_ne_or_sbtw {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} :
    (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ = 0 ↔ p₁ = p₃ ∧ p₁ ≠ p₂ ∨ sbtw (exprℝ) p₂ p₁ p₃ ∨ sbtw (exprℝ) p₂ p₃ p₁ :=
  by
  rw [angle_eq_zero_iff_ne_and_wbtw]
  by_cases hp₁p₂ : p₁ = p₂; · simp [hp₁p₂]
  by_cases hp₁p₃ : p₁ = p₃; · simp [hp₁p₃]
  by_cases hp₃p₂ : p₃ = p₂; · simp [hp₃p₂]
  simp [hp₁p₂, hp₁p₃, ne.symm hp₁p₃, sbtw, hp₃p₂]
#align angle_eq_zero_iff_eq_and_ne_or_sbtw angle_eq_zero_iff_eq_and_ne_or_sbtw
angle_eq_right:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- The angle ∠ABB at a point. -/
theorem angle_eq_right (p1 p2 : P) : (angle) p1 p2 p2 = real.pi / 2 := by rw [angle_comm, angle_eq_left]
#align angle_eq_right angle_eq_right
angle_eq_pi_iff_sbtw:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/-- The angle between three points is π if and only if the second point is strictly between the
other two. -/
theorem angle_eq_pi_iff_sbtw {p₁ p₂ p₃ : P} : (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ = real.pi ↔ sbtw (exprℝ) p₁ p₂ p₃ :=
  by
  refine' ⟨_, fun h => h.angle₁₂₃_eq_pi⟩
  rw [angle, angle_eq_pi_iff]
  rintro ⟨hp₁p₂, r, hr, hp₃p₂⟩
  refine'
    ⟨⟨1 / (1 - r),
        ⟨div_nonneg zero_le_one (sub_nonneg.2 (hr.le.trans zero_le_one)),
          (div_le_one (sub_pos.2 (hr.trans zero_lt_one))).2 ((le_sub_self_iff 1).2 hr.le)⟩,
        _⟩,
      (vsub_ne_zero.1 hp₁p₂).symm, _⟩
  · rw [← eq_vadd_iff_vsub_eq] at hp₃p₂
    rw [affine_map.line_map_apply, hp₃p₂, vadd_vsub_assoc, ← neg_vsub_eq_vsub_rev p₂ p₁, smul_neg, ← neg_smul, smul_add,
      smul_smul, ← add_smul, eq_comm, eq_vadd_iff_vsub_eq]
    convert (one_smul (exprℝ) («expr -ᵥ » p₂ p₁)).symm
    field_simp [(sub_pos.2 (hr.trans zero_lt_one)).ne.symm]
    abel
  · rw [ne_comm, ← @vsub_ne_zero V, hp₃p₂, smul_ne_zero_iff]
    exact ⟨hr.ne, hp₁p₂⟩
#align angle_eq_pi_iff_sbtw angle_eq_pi_iff_sbtw
angle_eq_of_ne:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- The angle ∠ABA at a point. -/
theorem angle_eq_of_ne {p1 p2 : P} (h : p1 ≠ p2) : (angle) p1 p2 p1 = 0 :=
  angle_self fun he => h (vsub_eq_zero_iff_eq.1 he)
#align angle_eq_of_ne angle_eq_of_ne
angle_eq_left:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- The angle ∠AAB at a point. -/
theorem angle_eq_left (p1 p2 : P) : (angle) p1 p1 p2 = real.pi / 2 :=
  by
  unfold angle
  rw [vsub_self]
  exact angle_zero_left _
#align angle_eq_left angle_eq_left

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- Vertical Angles Theorem: angles opposite each other, formed by two intersecting straight
lines, are equal. -/
theorem angle_eq_angle_of_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi {p1 p2 p3 p4 p5 : P} (hapc : (angle) p1 p5 p3 = real.pi)
    (hbpd : (angle) p2 p5 p4 = real.pi) : (angle) p1 p5 p2 = (angle) p3 p5 p4 := by
  linarith [angle_add_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi p1 hbpd, angle_comm p4 p5 p1,
    angle_add_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi p4 hapc, angle_comm p4 p5 p3]
#align angle_eq_angle_of_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi angle_eq_angle_of_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi
angle_eq_angle_of_angle_eq_pi:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- If ∠BCD = π, then ∠ABC = ∠ABD. -/
theorem angle_eq_angle_of_angle_eq_pi (p1 : P) {p2 p3 p4 : P} (h : (angle) p2 p3 p4 = real.pi) :
    (angle) p1 p2 p3 = (angle) p1 p2 p4 := by
  unfold angle at *
  rcases angle_eq_pi_iff.1 h with ⟨hp2p3, ⟨r, ⟨hr, hpr⟩⟩⟩
  rw [eq_comm]
  convert angle_smul_right_of_pos («expr -ᵥ » p1 p2) («expr -ᵥ » p3 p2) (add_pos (neg_pos_of_neg hr) zero_lt_one)
  rw [add_smul, ← neg_vsub_eq_vsub_rev p2 p3, smul_neg, neg_smul, ← hpr]
  simp
#align angle_eq_angle_of_angle_eq_pi angle_eq_angle_of_angle_eq_pi

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr -ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- Angles are translation invariant -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_const_vsub (p p₁ p₂ p₃ : P) :
    (angle) («expr -ᵥ » p p₁) («expr -ᵥ » p p₂) («expr -ᵥ » p p₃) = (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ :=
  (affine_isometry_equiv.const_vsub (exprℝ) p).to_affine_isometry.angle_map _ _ _
#align angle_const_vsub angle_const_vsub

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr +ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr +ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr +ᵥ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- Angles are translation invariant -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_const_vadd (v : V) (p₁ p₂ p₃ : P) :
    (angle) («expr +ᵥ » v p₁) («expr +ᵥ » v p₂) («expr +ᵥ » v p₃) = (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ :=
  (affine_isometry_equiv.const_vadd (exprℝ) P v).to_affine_isometry.angle_map _ _ _
#align angle_const_vadd angle_const_vadd

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- Angles in a vector space are invariant to inversion -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_const_sub (v : V) (v₁ v₂ v₃ : V) : (angle) (v - v₁) (v - v₂) (v - v₃) = (angle) v₁ v₂ v₃ := by
  simpa only [vsub_eq_sub] using angle_const_vsub _ _ _ _
#align angle_const_sub angle_const_sub
angle_const_add:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- Angles in a vector space are translation invariant -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_const_add (v : V) (v₁ v₂ v₃ : V) : (angle) (v + v₁) (v + v₂) (v + v₃) = (angle) v₁ v₂ v₃ :=
  angle_const_vadd _ _ _ _
#align angle_const_add angle_const_add
angle_comm:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- The angle at a point does not depend on the order of the other two
points. -/
theorem angle_comm (p1 p2 p3 : P) : (angle) p1 p2 p3 = (angle) p3 p2 p1 :=
  angle_comm _ _
#align angle_comm angle_comm
angle_coe:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
@[simp, norm_cast]
theorem _root_.affine_subspace.angle_coe {s : affine_subspace (exprℝ) P} (p₁ p₂ p₃ : s) :
    haveI : nonempty s := ⟨p₁⟩
    (angle) (p₁ : P) (p₂ : P) (p₃ : P) = (angle) p₁ p₂ p₃ :=
  haveI : nonempty s := ⟨p₁⟩
  s.subtypeₐᵢ.angle_map p₁ p₂ p₃
#align affine_subspace.angle_coe affine_subspace.angle_coe
angle_add_const:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/-- Angles in a vector space are translation invariant -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_add_const (v₁ v₂ v₃ : V) (v : V) : (angle) (v₁ + v) (v₂ + v) (v₃ + v) = (angle) v₁ v₂ v₃ :=
  angle_vadd_const _ _ _ _
#align angle_add_const angle_add_const
angle_add_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `angle -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If ∠BCD = π, then ∠ACB + ∠ACD = π. -/
theorem angle_add_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi (p1 : P) {p2 p3 p4 : P} (h : (angle) p2 p3 p4 = real.pi) :
    (angle) p1 p3 p2 + (angle) p1 p3 p4 = real.pi :=
  by
  unfold angle at h
  rw [angle_comm p1 p3 p2, angle_comm p1 p3 p4]
  unfold angle
  exact angle_add_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi _ h
#align angle_add_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi angle_add_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi
